oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: UNICEF tour - Tokyo, Japan - 1972 - part 12
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part twelve of a 1972 UNICEF fundraiser tour performance in Tokyo, Japan. Featuring Tex Ritter (host/performer) and Bruce Reynolds (announcer/interviewer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Big Wide Wonderful World Of Country Music (Leroy Van Dyke's band) (incomplete) -- (00:30) Bruce Reynolds talks about the show, and the artists promoting their own music in Japan -- (01:54) Reynolds talks about the tour's next show -- (02:15) Reynolds talks about the 9,000 people in the crowd -- (02:35) Tex Ritter talks about how well the show went -- (02:50) Ritter talks about the tour being an overall success, with many shows being sold out -- (03:33) Ritter talks about being on the tour not only to raise money for children but to help spread country music to other parts of the world -- (04:10) Ritter talks about being a member of the Country Music Association, and Tom T. Hall and Leroy Van Dyke being on the board -- (04:44) Ritter talks about all the different members of the music industry that make up the Country Music Association -- (05:13) Reynolds concludes the interview and thanks Ritter -- (05:28) Ritter thanks Reynolds and the Armed Forces Network for helping to cover the show -- Closing statements (Bruce Reynolds) -- Closing theme
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Ritter, Tex, 1905-1974; UNICEF.;
